labels.analysis: The MCP Server is primarily a Text-to-Speech (TTS) service that converts written text into natural-sounding speech, which can be played through the user's system. It allows users to integrate high-quality speech synthesis into their applications. The functionality is centered around enabling voice output, customizable via environment variables for tailored interactions. The main problem it solves is providing a simple, high-quality TTS solution that can be easily integrated into other applications or workflows.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "AI/ML Tools" was chosen because the server leverages text-to-speech synthesis, which is a machine learning-powered technology. "Browser Automation" is included as a secondary label because, while not its primary function, TTS can be used in automated workflows where voice output is needed. No unique functionality outside the predefined categories is observed.

server_info_crawled.name: Rime Text-to-Speech Server
server_info_crawled.author: @MatthewDailey/rime-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Convert text to speech and play it through your system's audio using high-quality voice synthesis. Enhance your applications with natural-sounding speech capabilities effortlessly. Customize speech behavior with environment variables for tailored interactions.

tools.name: speak
tools.description: Deploy Server Rime Text-to-Speech Server @MatthewDailey/rime-mcp Try in Playground

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@MatthewDailey/rime-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
